item.title:
What's new
We formulated the lipotype hypothesis
item.description: We wrote a piece with Giovanni D’Angelo titled “The lipotype hypothesis” on Nature Reviews Molecular Cell Biology! Considering recent evidence on lipid-cell response to interaction cues, we proposed that cell variability in lipid composition assists the divergence of differentiation trajectories, leading to the establishment of several cell identities.

About How does cellular diversity emerge in the brain? This question drives our research. Our methodological pursuits are directed toward answering it by building a comprehensive model of brain development. The name of our lab, the Laboratory of Brain Development and Biological Data Science, captures our belief that confronting the complexity of brain development requires making optimal use of large datasets: developing ways to generate, analyze, and extract meaning from them.
